senses.de: To organize different things or people to work properly together
senses.ex: She coordinated all the departments to work towards the same goal

Tips.title: Teamwork Enhancement
Tips.description: Implies improving collaboration among a group for efficiency.
Tips.example: The project manager coordinated the team to meet the tight deadline.

Tips.title: Leadership Action
Tips.description: Suggests a person is in charge of aligning efforts.
Tips.example: A supervisor must coordinate the staff's tasks during a shift.

Tips.title: Action Plan
Tips.description: Used for establishing a strategic way to achieve a goal.
Tips.example: To coordinate relief efforts, we drafted a comprehensive action plan.

senses.de: Working well together, or look good together

Tips.title: Aesthetic Harmony
Tips.description: Often refers to colors or styles that look good together.
Tips.example: Their house is beautifully decorated with coordinated colors.

Tips.title: Efficient Teamwork
Tips.description: Describes people working together smoothly and effectively.
Tips.example: The dance troupe moved with perfectly coordinated steps.

senses.de: Each pair of numbers giving the position of a point in a plane by reference to two fixed lines, the axes

Tips.title: Location Markers
Tips.description: References a specific point within a larger system or grid.
Tips.example: Find the treasure by locating its coordinates on the map.

Tips.title: Mathematical Term
Tips.description: Specific to geometry for describing positions in space.
Tips.example: Using graph paper, plot the point at coordinates (x, y).

Tips.title: Navigation Help
Tips.description: Helpful in finding locations, used in GPS and maps.
Tips.example: Enter the coordinates to find the closest coffee shop.

senses.de: To be equal in rank or importance
senses.ex: The human resources department coordinates with the finance department

Tips.title: Partnership Implication
Tips.description: Conveys a sense of collaboration without hierarchy.
Tips.example: During the merger, sales and marketing teams coordinated closely.

Tips.title: Equal Standing
Tips.description: Implies two or more elements have the same level of importance.
Tips.example: In debates, all speakers' points should be coordinated.

Align.wordDefinition:
Align refers to when two or more things are arranged in such a way that they are in agreement or in a straight line with each other.

For example, a construction team will align the various pieces of a building to ensure that they fit together perfectly.

Collaborate.wordDefinition:
Collaborate means to work together with others on a shared goal or project. It involves actively contributing ideas, feedback, and effort towards a common objective.

Collaboration is applicable when people need to jointly work on a task or project that requires multiple skill sets or perspectives.

Coordination is applicable when people need to work together, but their roles are more defined and there is less need for active collaboration.

In summary, collaboration is about actively working together towards a shared goal, while coordination is about organizing and arranging people and resources to work towards a goal.

Correlate.wordDefinition:
Coordinate refers to arranging or organizing things to work together in a planned way, while correlate refers to the relationship or connection between two things.

The performance of a player may correlate with their amount of practice or training.

Coordinate is used when referring to the process of planning or organizing, while correlate is used when referring to the relationship between two things.

Harmonize.wordDefinition:
Harmonize means to make different things or people work together in a way that is pleasing or enjoyable to experience.

For example, if you harmonize music, you make sure that the different parts of the song work together to create a beautiful and enjoyable sound.

Coordinate focuses on making sure things work well together, while harmonize focuses on making sure things work together in a way that is enjoyable.

Integrate.wordDefinition:
Integrate means to combine different things into a unified whole. In the same group project, each team member might integrate their individual efforts to create a final product that is cohesive and complete.

Coordinate is best used when talking about organizing and managing different parts or people, while integrate is used when referring to combining and unifying different ideas or components.

Organize.wordDefinition:
Organize means to arrange or sort things in an orderly manner. It involves putting things in a specific order or sequence so that they can be easily accessed, used, or understood.

You might organize your bedroom by sorting your clothes, putting away your books, and tidying up your desk.

Coordinate is about managing and directing different elements towards a common goal, while organize is about arranging things in a structured and logical manner.

Synchronize.wordDefinition:
Synchronize means to make different things happen at the same time, or to ensure that they are timed properly.

For example, when dancers move their bodies to the beat of the music, they are synchronizing their movements with the rhythm.

Coordinate is more about planning and bringing things together, while synchronize is more about timing and making things happen simultaneously.

Systematize.wordDefinition:
Coordinate and systematize are both verbs that involve arranging things in a particular way, but they have slightly different meanings.

- Systematize means to arrange something in a methodical and structured way. It implies creating a system or a framework of rules, procedures, or processes that govern the way things should be done.

For example, when a company systematizes its workflows, it sets up a sequence of steps that employees have to follow for each task they perform.

Unify.wordDefinition:
Unify means to bring things or people together to form a single unit or entity.

It is used when there are multiple elements or groups that need to be merged as a whole. For example, a company may try to unify all of its departments under one vision and mission statement.

Coordinate is used when there are multiple parts that need to work together effectively, while unify is used when multiple elements or groups need to be merged into a single entity or unit.

quotes.Text: There are a number of traits that combine to create entrepreneurial potential. We find that openness coordinates very well with successful entrepreneurs. The more open-minded you are, the more you see the world as it actually is. The more closed-minded, the more you see the world as you want it to be.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Adeo Ressi

quotes.Text: I played tennis a lot when I had the skull injury. For the first two months of my preparation, it was all I could do. It is a great sport for me because it helps my hand-eye coordination, and you need quick feet, which is a good exercise for a keeper.
quotes.Title: Czechoslovakian Athlete
quotes.Name: Petr Cech

quotes.Text: To create an open protocol which helps coordinate resources towards a common goal, the resources need to be known at some level in the same way a lot of of data on the web needs to be public for it to be traversable and useful.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Fred Ehrsam

quotes.Text: Finger foods can help little ones to explore food at their own pace. They are also great for helping them to develop hand-eye coordination and encouraging them to try out a variety of textures.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Joe Wicks

quotes.Text: If you want to get each individual's honest opinion, you don't want that opinion to be influenced by others who are present, much less allow a group to coordinate what they are going to say.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Thomas Sowell

quotes.Text: By coordinating with international partners on scientific issues, we strengthen the U.S. scientific enterprise and promote the free exchange of ideas in other nations.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Dan Lipinski

quotes.Text: Foot work, hand-eye coordination. There's a lot of things. If you just watch basketball, you can tell where it would help someone who's receiving the ball.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Austin Seferian-Jenkins

quotes.Text: I often speak about tennis being one of the most important sports when I was growing up, for my hand-eye coordination and quick feet.
quotes.Title: South African Athlete
quotes.Name: AB de Villiers

quotes.Text: I used to play a lot of different sports. Now when I look back, I understand that it really helped with my hand-eye coordination.
quotes.Name: Sunil Chhetri

quotes.Text: And I'm not very coordinated, either. Only on ice skates, not in real life.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Julie Benz
